query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Qual venne a Climenè, per accertarsi 2 di ciò ch’avëa incontro a sé udito, 3 quei ch’ancor fa li padri ai figli scarsi;
query.error: **English:** 1 As Climenè came to make sure 2 of what she had heard against her, 3 he who still makes fathers scarce for their sons;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 tal era io, e tal era sentito 5 e da Beatrice e da la santa lampa 6 che pria per me avea mutato sito.
query.error: **English:** 4 such was I, and such was I perceived 5 by Beatrice and by the holy lamp 6 that had previously changed place for me.
query.result: 4 henna omov, ha henna o klevs 5 gans Beatrice ha'n lamp sans, 6 ow tos a wra chanjys le mayth rag anfans.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.result: 7 Rag henna ow leveris vystresses "Kas an flam 8 a'th dhisir", hi a leveris dhym, "vel ylliffo 9 merkys da yn selyow a-ves".

query.prompt:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.error: **English:** 28 Thus I said to that same light 29 that had spoken to me before; and as Beatrice wished, 30 my desire was confessed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.result: 40 Mes nyns yw tak necessity a henna 41 mes dell vel an fas le mayth yma ow spectya 42 long a wra discendya warbarth gans an avon."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 Da indi, sì come viene ad orecchia 44 dolce armonia da organo, mi viene 45 a vista il tempo che ti s’apparecchia.
query.error: **English:** 43 From there, just as sweet harmony comes to the ear 44 from an organ, there comes to 45 my sight the time that is preparing for you.
query.result: 43 A henna, dell dell dhe'n clust 44 harmoni dowrus a organ, dhe'm dheus 45 dhe'm golwg an amser a wra parotti rag dhis.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Qual si partio Ipolito d’Atene 47 per la spietata e perfida noverca, 48 tal di Fiorenza partir ti convene.
query.error: **English:** 46 As Hippolytus departed from Athens 47 because of his pitiless and treacherous stepmother, 48 so you must depart from Florence.
query.result: 46 Dell dell Ipolito a partias a Athen 47 rag y'n noverca spietus ha perfidus, 48 henna dell ti a wra parti a Florença.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Questo si vuole e questo già si cerca, 50 e tosto verrà fatto a chi ciò pensa 51 là dove Cristo tutto dì si merca.
query.error: **English:** 49 This is what is desired and this is already being sought, 50 and it will soon be done by those who think about it, 51 there where Christ is bought and sold every day.
query.result: 49 Hemm awos henna ha henna yw kehevelys, 50 ha bys vyth efan dhegemmir a wravyth henna, 51 ena le mayth Krist dhysprennys pub dydh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 La colpa seguirà la parte offensa 53 in grido, come suol; ma la vendetta 54 fia testimonio al ver che la dispensa.
query.error: **English:** 52 The fault will follow the offended party 53 with a cry, as it usually does; but vengeance 54 will bear witness to the truth that excuses it.
query.result: 52 An golh a sew an rann offendythys 53 yn gri, dell yw an arver; mes an venjans 54 a vydh tysti dhe'n gwir a'y dyskarth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 Tu lascerai ogne cosa diletta 56 più caramente; e questo è quello strale 57 che l’arco de lo essilio pria saetta.
query.error: **English:** 55 You will leave behind everything you hold dear, 56 most preciously; and this is the arrow 57 that the bow of exile shoots first.
query.result: 55 Ti a wra vyth pub traow a gar, 56 moyha karantek; ha henna yw an saeth 57 a wra an bogh a'n esili a saetha kyns.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 Tu proverai sì come sa di sale 59 lo pane altrui, e come è duro calle 60 lo scendere e ’l salir per l’altrui scale.
query.error: **English:** 58 You will experience how salty is the bread of others, 59 and how hard is the path 60 of going up and down another man's stairs.
query.result: 58 Ti a brof vyth pyth yw blas an holen aral, 59 ha pyth yw kales an fordh 60 a sevel ha mosya war gresen aral.

query.prompt:
